quotes.text: If you genuinely want something, don't wait for it - teach yourself.
quotes.author: Gurbaksh Chahal

quotes.text: Formal education will make you a living, self-education will make you a fortune.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.text: You cannot push anyone up a ladder unless he is willing to climb a little himself.
quotes.author: Andrew Carnegie

quotes.text: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.text: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Trust thyself: every heart vibrates to that iron string.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Hope itself is like a star- not to be seen in the sunshine of prosperity, and only to be discovered in the night of adversity.
quotes.author: Charles Spurgeon

quotes.text: But at any rate, the point is that God is what nobody admits to being, and everybody really is.
quotes.author: Alan Watts

quotes.text: Things are as they are. Looking out into it the universe at night, we make no comparisons between right and wrong stars, nor between well and badly arranged constellations.
quotes.author: Alan Watts

quotes.text: You are that vast thing that you see far, far off with great telescopes.
quotes.author: Alan Watts

quotes.text: Whatever we expect with confidence becomes our own self-fulfilling prophecy.
quotes.author: Brian Tracy

quotes.text: Only through our connectedness to others can we really know and enhance the self. And only through working on the self can we begin to enhance our connectedness to others.
quotes.author: Harriet Lerner

quotes.text: The self is not something ready-made, but something in continuous formation through choice of action.
quotes.author: John Dewey

quotes.text: With the realization of one's own potential and self-confidence in one's ability, one can build a better world.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.text: When we quit thinking primarily about ourselves and our own self-preservation, we undergo a truly heroic transformation of consciousness.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.text: The aim of life is self-development. To realize one's nature perfectly - that is what each of us is here for.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: The greater part of human pain is unnecessary. It is self-created as long as the unobserved mind runs your life.
quotes.author: Eckhart Tolle

quotes.text: I, too, do not envision a doctrine of self the clinging to which there would not arise sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: To free us from the expectations of others, to give us back to ourselves... there lies the great, singular power of self-respect.
quotes.author: Joan Didion
